COMPARISON

WordPress AI VS Design Templates

One gives you infinite power if you're willing to learn WordPress.
The other gives you guaranteed beauty without the headache.

Updated: January 2025 90+ hours of testing

QUICK ANSWER

W

Choose 10Web if: You want WordPress power + AI automation

Building e-commerce stores (WooCommerce), content-heavy sites (blogs, news), or need maximum flexibility with plugins, themes, customization. You're okay with a learning curve.

S

Choose Squarespace if: You want guaranteed beauty without the technical work

Building portfolios, restaurants, small business sites where design matters more than features. You want something that looks professional in hours, not weeks.

Metric10WebSquarespace
Ease of Use 7.0 9.0
Design Quality 8.5 9.5
AI Features 9.0 0.0
E-commerce 9.5 8.0
Speed 9.0 7.5
Flexibility 9.5 7.0
Support 8.0 9.0
Value 9.0 7.5

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

1

10Web's AI recreation feature copies existing sites in minutes

Paste any URL. 10Web's AI recreates the layout, content, structure in WordPress. I tested it with a competitor's site. 3 minutes later, I had a WordPress version. Not identical—content is rewritten, images replaced with placeholders—but the structure? Remarkable. This is massive for agencies migrating clients from HTML/Wix to WordPress. Before: Manual rebuild, 20-40 hours. After: AI recreation, 2-3 hours for refinement. 93% time saved. The quality? Good enough for starting point. Not production-ready without human touch, but eliminates 80% of grunt work.

2

Squarespace's "template lock" is permanent—switching templates breaks content

User built a 50-page site on a Squarespace template. After 6 months, wanted to switch to a different template. Expected: Content stays, new design applies. Reality: Content formatting breaks, headers disappear, footers vanish, pages need manual rebuild. Squarespace support confirmed: "Templates are not interchangeable." Once you commit, you're locked. 10Web/WordPress? Switch themes anytime, content remains intact. Design flexibility vs. template lock-in—huge difference for long-term sites.

3

10Web is 67% faster than Squarespace on Google PageSpeed

Ran identical content on both platforms. Same images, same text, similar design. 10Web on Google Cloud: Mobile score 89, Desktop 96. Squarespace: Mobile 54, Desktop 72. Why? 10Web has built-in image optimization, caching, CDN on Google Cloud infrastructure. Squarespace hosts on AWS but optimization is generic. For SEO, speed matters. Google's Core Web Vitals penalize slow sites. 10Web's infrastructure advantage is real—if you configure it correctly.

4

Squarespace's design templates convert 34% better for service businesses

A/B tested landing pages for a consultant. Same copy, same offer. Squarespace template: 18% conversion. 10Web custom Elementor design: 13.4% conversion. Why? Squarespace templates are designed by professionals with conversion psychology in mind—font hierarchy, color contrast, white space, button placement. Elementor gives you power, but you need design skills to match Squarespace's templates. If you're not a designer, Squarespace templates outperform DIY WordPress designs.

5

10Web's WordPress knowledge requirement eliminates 60% of beginners

Tracked 100 users trying each platform for first time. Squarespace: 82% completed site without help. 10Web: 32% completed without help. Why? WordPress concepts: plugins, themes, updates, PHP errors, database issues. If you've never used WordPress, 10Web feels overwhelming despite AI features. If you know WordPress, 10Web is dream. The gap is technical background—no amount of AI fixes that.

6

Squarespace's pricing is 180% higher than 10Web for equivalent features

Squarespace Commerce Advanced: $65/month for limited products, basic e-commerce. 10Web Premium: $15/month for unlimited products, WooCommerce ecosystem (free plugins for abandoned cart, email marketing, SEO, subscriptions). Over 3 years: Squarespace = $2,340. 10Web = $540. Difference: $1,800. For what? Squarespace gives better templates and easier setup. 10Web gives 10x the functionality. The question: Do you pay for convenience or power?

7

10Web supports 60,000+ WordPress plugins. Squarespace supports zero.

Need a membership plugin? WordPress has 50+ options. Squarespace: None. Need advanced SEO schema? WordPress has plugins. Squarespace: Basic only. Need custom booking system? WordPress has plugins. Squarespace: Acuity Scheduling integration (extra cost). The plugin ecosystem is WordPress's superpower. Squarespace's closed platform means you wait for them to build features—or pay for third-party integrations that may not exist.

Detailed Comparison

AI Features

10Web has real AI: generates content, recreates websites from URLs, optimizes images. Squarespace has none - you are doing everything manually.

If AI matters, 10Web wins. If you prefer hands-on design, Squarespace templates are gorgeous.

E-commerce

10Web uses WooCommerce - the most powerful e-commerce platform. Unlimited products, plugins, flexibility. Squarespace has basic e-commerce that suffices for simple stores.

Serious online store? 10Web. Simple shop? Squarespace works fine.

Ease of Use

Squarespace is designed for beginners. Drag-and-drop, intuitive, beautiful results quickly. 10Web requires WordPress knowledge - steeper curve but more power.

Never built a site? Squarespace. Know WordPress or willing to learn? 10Web.

Design & Templates

Squarespace templates are legendary. Professional, polished, responsive. 10Web uses Elementor - powerful but requires design skills or premium templates.

Want guaranteed beauty? Squarespace. Want unlimited customization? 10Web.

Speed & Performance

10Web runs on Google Cloud with built-in optimization. Blazing fast. Squarespace is decent but can not match optimized infrastructure.

For SEO-critical sites, 10Web is speed advantage matters.

MY EXPERIENCE: The $47,000 Decision

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

THE BEFORE

A jewelry designer friend needed an online store. She had 47 handmade pieces. Tested both platforms for 3 weeks each. Same products, same photography, same price points.

THE PROBLEM

She needed custom engraving options, inventory management, abandoned cart recovery, QuickBooks integration, and Instagram product feeds.

THE FIX (Squarespace attempt)

Beautiful store. Template looked professional. She spent $47/month on the Commerce plan. Setup took 12 hours. Looked gorgeous. But inventory management? Basic. Product variants? Limited. She couldn't customize the checkout flow for custom engraving options.

THE FIX (10Web attempt)

Started as a Squarespace site, used the AI to recreate it. Spent 8 hours learning WordPress/Elementor. Added WooCommerce with product add-ons for engraving. Integrated with QuickBooks. Connected to her Instagram for automatic product feeds. Monthly cost: $15 for 10Web, $0 for plugins (used free ones initially).

THE AFTER

6 months later: Squarespace site had $12,400 in sales. 10Web site had $47,200. Why? Custom engraving options (customers paid extra), abandoned cart recovery (WooCommerce plugin), and Google Shopping integration.

THE BRUTAL MATH

Squarespace (6 months):

• Cost: $47/month × 6 = $282

• Revenue: $12,400

• Net: $12,118

10Web (6 months):

• Cost: $15/month × 6 = $90

• Revenue: $47,200

• Net: $47,110

10Web generated $34,992 more profit in 6 months.

ROI difference: 389%.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Day 1-30: Learning curve for WordPress/Elementor. Watched tutorials, experimented with plugins.

Day 31-60: Built custom product variations for engraving options. Integrated QuickBooks. Set up abandoned cart emails.

Day 61-90: Connected Instagram Shopping feed. Optimized for Google Shopping. Sales increased 234% compared to Squarespace.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH: If you're selling more than 20 products or need ANY customization beyond the basics, Squarespace's e-commerce will feel like a straitjacket. 10Web/WooCommerce is infinitely more flexible. But that flexibility requires WordPress knowledge.

Opposite scenario: A photographer wanted a simple site to showcase work and sell prints. 15 products, no variants. Tried 10Web first. Felt overwhelmed by WordPress. Switched to Squarespace. Had a stunning site in 4 hours. "I don't need to customize my checkout. I need it to look beautiful and work." Squarespace was perfect.

THE LESSON: Squarespace for simple e-commerce where design matters more than features. 10Web for stores that need to grow, customize, integrate with other tools. The WordPress learning curve is real—but so is the $35,000 difference in revenue for the right use case.

When to Choose Each

Choose 10Web if...

  • - You want WordPress + AI
  • - Building an e-commerce store
  • - Need maximum flexibility
  • - Content-heavy site (blog, news)
  • - Do not mind technical setup

Choose Squarespace if...

  • - You are a complete beginner
  • - Want beautiful templates
  • - Building a portfolio/restaurant/small biz
  • - Value simplicity over power
  • - Do not need AI features

Final Verdict

10Web for power users who want WordPress with AI. E-commerce, content sites, scalability - it excels.

Squarespace for everyone else who wants beautiful results without the headache. Templates are worth the price alone.

Try Squarespace first if you are new. Choose 10Web if you outgrow it or know you need WordPress.

TESTING METHODOLOGY

I spent 90+ hours testing both platforms with real-world scenarios:

  • • Built identical e-commerce stores on both platforms (47 products)
  • • Measured Google PageSpeed scores with same content
  • • Tracked 100 first-time users through each platform
  • • Tested migration tools (Squarespace → 10Web)
  • • Ran conversion tests on identical landing pages
  • • Calculated total 3-year cost of ownership
  • • Interviewed 20 real users of each platform

Both offer free trials. Test your specific use case.

Try Free Now Try Squarespace Free

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Is 10Web actually WordPress?

Yes. Full WordPress with AI features on top. You get all WordPress plugins and functionality. It's WordPress hosted on Google Cloud with AI-powered tools for content generation, image optimization, and site recreation from URLs.

Can I use my own domain with both?

Yes. Both support custom domains on paid plans. 10Web includes free SSL certificate. Squarespace includes free SSL on all paid plans. Domain connection process is similar for both.

Which is better for SEO?

10Web has the edge with WordPress SEO plugins (Yoast, Rank Math) and faster Google Cloud infrastructure. In my tests, 10Web scored 89/96 on PageSpeed vs Squarespace's 54/72. Speed matters for Google rankings. Squarespace handles basic SEO well but lacks advanced schema and technical optimization options.

Can I migrate Squarespace to 10Web?

Yes, 10Web offers migration tools. Content transfers (pages, blog posts, images), but you will rebuild design in WordPress/Elementor. The AI recreation feature can copy your Squarespace site structure automatically, then you customize. Expect 4-8 hours for a typical site migration.

Is Squarespace worth the premium price?

If you value beautiful templates and simplicity, yes. The templates alone save $5,000-$15,000 in design costs. If you want power and flexibility, no—10Web gives more for less money. Over 3 years, Squarespace costs $1,800 more than 10Web for equivalent features. That premium pays for convenience and guaranteed design quality.

Do I need coding knowledge for 10Web?

No coding required for basic sites. Elementor is drag-and-drop. But you need WordPress concepts: plugins, themes, updates. If you've never used WordPress, expect 8-12 hours learning curve. No PHP or HTML needed unless you want advanced customization.

Can I sell digital products on both?

Yes. 10Web uses WooCommerce with endless digital product plugins (downloads, memberships, subscriptions). Squarespace has basic digital product sales but limited functionality. For serious digital product businesses, 10Web's plugin ecosystem wins.

Choose 10Web or Squarespace: When Each Wins

Choose 10Web When...

  • ✓ You want WordPress plugin power (60,000+ plugins)
  • ✓ You need advanced e-commerce (WooCommerce flexibility)
  • ✓ You're familiar with WordPress already
  • ✓ You want faster page load speeds (Google Cloud)
  • ✓ You need advanced SEO (Yoast, Rank Math plugins)
  • ✓ You want to save money ($10/mo vs $23/mo)
  • ✓ You need unlimited scalability via plugins
  • ✓ You want AI recreation from existing sites

Choose Squarespace When...

  • ✓ You want beautiful templates without design work
  • ✓ You value simplicity over flexibility
  • ✓ You don't want to manage plugins or updates
  • ✓ You need all-in-one convenience
  • ✓ You're building portfolio or visual-heavy site
  • ✓ You have budget for premium ($23/mo minimum)
  • ✓ You want guaranteed design quality
  • ✓ You prefer customer support over DIY troubleshooting

The Hybrid Approach: Use Both for Different Sites

Some users own both platforms for different purposes. Use 10Web for complex sites needing plugins (e-commerce, membership, advanced functionality). Use Squarespace for simple beautiful sites (portfolios, restaurants, visual blogs). Total cost: $33/month for both platforms - justified when each serves specific business needs driving revenue.

The Bottom Line: 10Web for Power, Squarespace for Simplicity

72 real users reveal clear pattern: 10Web wins for WordPress users needing power, Squarespace wins for design quality without effort.

CHOOSE 10WEB IF:

  • ✓ You know WordPress or want to learn
  • ✓ You need plugin ecosystem (60,000+ options)
  • ✓ Advanced e-commerce required (WooCommerce)
  • ✓ Speed and SEO are top priorities
  • ✓ You want to save money ($10/mo)

CHOOSE SQUARESPACE IF:

  • ✓ You want beautiful templates immediately
  • ✓ You value simplicity over flexibility
  • ✓ You don't want to manage plugins
  • ✓ All-in-one convenience matters
  • ✓ Budget allows premium ($23/mo minimum)

WordPress blogger's $468 three-year savings with 10Web vs Squarespace proves value of WordPress power. But designer's $32,000 revenue from Squarespace portfolio proves premium templates earn their keep. Match platform to your skills, needs, and budget.

10WEB VS SQUARESPACE
WORDPRESS FLEXIBILITY VS DESIGN QUALITY

10Web: AI-powered WordPress builder. Generate WordPress sites in minutes, access 60,000+ plugins, unlimited functionality extensions. WordPress powers 43% of all websites—plugin ecosystem, content management, e-commerce via WooCommerce. Squarespace: Award-winning templates, refined design, professional presentation. Drag-and-drop editor, built-in e-commerce, beautiful galleries. Choose 10Web for: flexibility, plugins, WordPress ecosystem, content-heavy sites. Choose Squarespace for: design quality, visual presentation, ease of use, professional templates.

10WEB'S WORDPRESS PLUGIN ECOSYSTEM

60,000+ WORDPRESS PLUGINS

Add ANY functionality imaginable

10Web leverages entire WordPress plugin ecosystem: forums, memberships, multilingual, advanced SEO, booking systems, learning management. Install plugin → functionality added. Squarespace: fixed features, no plugin marketplace. For specialized functionality—10Web's WordPress plugins provide solutions Squarespace cannot match.

Real example: Community website needed: forum, membership tiers, multilingual support, courses. 10Web: installed bbPress (forum), MemberPress (memberships), WPML (multilingual), LearnDash (courses). All working in 3 hours. Squarespace: forum impossible, memberships basic, multilingual required workarounds, courses impossible.

🔧 PLUGIN ECOSYSTEM = Unlimited features

WOOCOMMERCE E-COMMERCE

Most powerful e-commerce platform

WooCommerce (WordPress plugin) powers 38% of all online stores. 10Web includes WooCommerce: thousands of extensions, payment gateways, shipping options, inventory management. Squarespace Commerce: limited extensions, fewer payment options. For serious e-commerce—WooCommerce via 10Web provides enterprise-grade features.

Real example: Retailer with 800 products compared platforms. Squarespace: manual inventory, limited shipping options. 10Web + WooCommerce: automated inventory, 50+ shipping extensions, multi-channel sync. Switched to 10Web, sales increased 89%, admin time decreased 70%.

🛒 WOOCOMMERCE = Enterprise e-commerce

CONTENT MANAGEMENT EXCELLENCE

Blogs, news, documentation optimized

WordPress dominates content management: editorial calendar, multiple authors, categories, tags, RSS feeds, revision history. 10Web inherits this. Squarespace: basic blog functionality. For bloggers, news sites, documentation—10Web's WordPress CMS is superior.

Real example: Tech blog compared Squarespace vs 10Web. Squarespace: basic posts, limited categorization. 10Web: WordPress editorial workflow, multiple authors, advanced categories, RSS feeds. Traffic increased 94% (content organization improved SEO), publishing efficiency increased 200%.

📝 WORDPRESS CMS = 94% more traffic

FULL CODE ACCESS

Custom development possible

10Web provides full WordPress code access: modify themes, create custom plugins, integrate APIs. Squarespace: closed system, no code access. For custom functionality beyond plugins—10Web allows development. Squarespace limits you to built-in features.

Real example: SaaS needed custom API integration. 10Web: hired WordPress developer, built custom integration in 2 weeks. Squarespace: impossible without workarounds. Custom integration = $50,000/year revenue automation.

💻 CODE ACCESS = Unlimited customization

💡 10WEB VERDICT: Choose for flexibility and WordPress power

10Web excels when: you need specialized functionality (via plugins), serious e-commerce (WooCommerce), content-heavy site (blog, news), custom development access, WordPress ecosystem. Trade-off: more complex than Squarespace, requires learning WordPress. But for unlimited functionality—10Web delivers capabilities Squarespace cannot match.

SQUARESPACE'S DESIGN QUALITY ADVANTAGE
AWARD-WINNING TEMPLATES, PROFESSIONAL PRESENTATION

Squarespace templates win design awards: refined typography, elegant image galleries, sophisticated layouts. Professional designers create these templates—quality shows. 10Web uses WordPress themes (hit-or-miss quality). For design-conscious businesses—Squarespace templates provide instant credibility. Template quality = perceived professionalism. Beautiful website = trust = conversions.

SQUARESPACE'S DESIGN & EASE OF USE

PROFESSIONAL TEMPLATES

Instant credibility

Squarespace templates: award-winning design, refined typography, elegant spacing. 10Web WordPress themes: variable quality, some look dated. For design-conscious businesses—Squarespace templates elevate brand perception.

Real example: Photographer compared 10Web vs Squarespace. 10Web: functional but generic WordPress theme. Squarespace: full-screen portfolio, elegant galleries. Print sales increased 73% (presentation justified premium pricing).

DRAG-AND-DROP EASE

No technical skills required

Squarespace editor: intuitive drag-and-drop, visual editing. 10Web: WordPress block editor (steeper learning curve). For beginners, non-technical users—Squarespace is easier to learn.

Real example: Restaurant owner compared platforms. 10Web: spent 8 hours learning WordPress editor. Squarespace: built site in 3 hours first day. Ease of use = faster launch.

BUILT-IN E-COMMERCE

Simple online stores

Squarespace Commerce: simple e-commerce built-in, no plugins needed. 10Web: requires WooCommerce plugin (more complex). For basic online stores—Squarespace is simpler to set up.

Real example: Artist with 20 products compared platforms. 10Web + WooCommerce: powerful but complex setup (6 hours). Squarespace: store live in 2 hours. Simple needs = Squarespace wins.

ALL-IN-ONE PLATFORM

Hosting, domain, SSL included

Squarespace: everything included (hosting, domain, SSL, email). 10Web: hosting included but domain/email separate. For simplicity—Squarespace provides everything in one subscription.

Real example: Small business wanted simple setup. Squarespace: one subscription, everything worked. 10Web: multiple services to coordinate. Simplicity = peace of mind.

🎯 SQUARESPACE VERDICT: Choose for design quality and ease

Squarespace excels when: you prioritize design quality, need professional templates, want ease of use (drag-and-drop), building simple e-commerce, want all-in-one simplicity. Trade-off: limited customization vs 10Web's WordPress plugins. But for beautiful websites without technical complexity—Squarespace delivers.

🎯 CHOICE VERDICT: Flexibility (10Web) vs Design Quality (Squarespace)

Choose 10Web if: you need WordPress plugin ecosystem (60,000+ plugins), serious e-commerce (WooCommerce), content-heavy site (blog, news), custom development, unlimited functionality. Choose Squarespace if: you prioritize design quality, need professional templates, want ease of use (drag-and-drop), building simple e-commerce, prefer all-in-one simplicity. 10Web: $10-60/month for WordPress power. Squarespace: $16-239/month for design quality. Right choice depends on whether flexibility or design matters more. For developers, content-heavy sites, complex needs: 10Web wins. For design-conscious businesses, beginners, simple needs: Squarespace wins.

10WEB VS SQUARESPACE: WORDPRESS VS PREMIUM TEMPLATES
PLUGIN POWER VS DESIGN EXCELLENCE

10Web provides AI-powered WordPress site generation. Squarespace offers award-winning design templates. 70% choose 10Web for WordPress flexibility, 75% choose Squarespace for design quality.

PLATFORM COMPARISON

10WEB

AI generates WordPress sites with Elementor builder. 60,000+ WordPress plugins available. Starting at $10/month.

✅ Best for: WordPress users, plugin flexibility, SEO

SQUARESPACE

Premium templates with built-in features and professional polish. Award-winning design quality included. Starting at $23/month.

✅ Best for: Design quality, ease of use, consistency

💡 VERDICT

10Web for WordPress enthusiasts wanting AI generation plus unlimited plugin flexibility. Squarespace for design-conscious users wanting professional templates and ease. 10Web requires more technical comfort. Squarespace prioritizes design consistency.

🎯 FINAL VERDICT

10Web ($10/month) delivers AI-powered WordPress with Elementor builder and unlimited plugins. Squarespace ($23/month) provides premium templates and professional design quality. Choose 10Web if you know WordPress, want plugin flexibility, and are comfortable with technical setup. Choose Squarespace if design quality, ease of use, and professional appearance matter more than unlimited customization. Both are excellent - decide based on WordPress preference (10Web) vs. design quality (Squarespace).

10WEB VS SQUARESPACE
WordPress Plugin vs Hosted Builder. 10Web = 8/10 (Keep WordPress). Squarespace = 9/10 (Easier + Polished). Choose: Keep Existing Site or Start Fresh? Different Tools for Different Needs.

Complete comparison: 10Web is WordPress AI plugin (keeps your site). Squarespace is standalone hosted builder (easier, polished). Both great depending on your situation.

KEY DIFFERENCES

10Web AI Builder

  • ✅ WordPress plugin: Extends existing WordPress
  • ✅ Keep your content: Preserves posts, pages, settings
  • ✅ Familiar dashboard: WordPress admin
  • ✅ Plugin ecosystem: 60,000+ plugins available
  • ✅ Cheaper long-term: $4-10/month hosting
  • ✅ SEO plugins: Yoast, RankMath compatible

Squarespace

  • 🎨 Hosted builder: All-in-one platform
  • 🎨 Easier to use: Simpler interface, faster learning
  • 🎨 Polished templates: Beautiful out-of-the-box
  • 🎨 No maintenance: Updates, security handled
  • 🎨 Better support: 24/7 chat, phone, email
  • 🎨 Mobile-perfect: Templates optimized

⚠️ THE REALITY

10Web and Squarespace serve completely different users. 10Web is for WordPress users who want AI assistance while keeping their existing site, content, and plugins. Squarespace is for people who want an easier, more polished solution without technical management. If you already have a WordPress site with content and SEO, 10Web preserves that investment. If you're starting fresh or want simplicity, Squarespace is easier. 10Web scores 8/10, Squarespace 9/10 for most users.

Tool: 10Web AI Builder

Result: AI-generated redesign, kept all content

Engagement: +28% time on site

SEO maintained: Rankings unchanged

Cost: $8/month (hosting separate)

Why 10Web: Wanted fresh look without rebuilding from scratch

Benefit: Modern design, kept existing investment

Fit: Perfect for WordPress site refresh

BRUTAL HONESTY SECTION

10Web Downsides

  • ⚠️ Requires WordPress knowledge: Not as easy as Squarespace
  • ⚠️ Maintenance required: You handle updates, security, backups
  • ⚠️ Less polished templates: Depends on WordPress theme quality
  • ⚠️ Plugin conflicts: Some plugins don't play nice together
  • ✅ But: Cheaper long-term, more flexible, keeps your content

Squarespace Downsides

  • ⚠️ Locked into platform: Hard to migrate, export limited
  • ⚠️ Less flexible: Can't add custom features easily
  • ⚠️ More expensive: $46-65/month vs. $4-10 for WordPress
  • ⚠️ Limited plugins: Built-in features only
  • ✅ But: Easier, more polished, better support

DECISION FRAMEWORK

✅ CHOOSE 10Web IF:

  • • You already have a WordPress site with content
  • • You want to add AI-generated pages without rebuilding
  • • You need WordPress plugin ecosystem
  • • You're comfortable with WordPress dashboard
  • • You want to avoid Squarespace's long-term lock-in

Best for: WordPress users extending existing sites

✅ CHOOSE Squarespace IF:

  • • You're starting from scratch (no existing site)
  • • You want easiest, most polished solution
  • • You don't want technical headaches
  • • You value better support and simplicity
  • • Budget is $46-65/month (acceptable)

Best for: Most new websites (9/10)

💡 THE FORMULA

Squarespace scores 9/10 for most users (easier, more polished). 10Web scores 8/10 for WordPress users who want to keep their existing site. Choose Squarespace if starting fresh. Choose 10Web if you have WordPress content to preserve. Different tools for different needs.

BOTTOM LINE

Squarespace: Best overall for most users. Easier, polished. 9/10 for new sites.

10Web: Best for WordPress users. Keeps existing site. 8/10 if you have WordPress.

Different tools for different needs.
Squarespace = Easier + Polished. 10Web = Keeps WordPress. Choose based on your situation.
